data.title: Cipher square
data.statement:
Given a 5 x 5 grid of letters where top-left is (0, 0), output the decoded lines of text.

`  A     B     C     D     E
  J     I     H     G     F
  K     L     M     N     O
  T     S     R     Z     P
 Q/U    V     W     X     Y`

Decode example:  [[1]][[3]] = (1, 3) = << S>>

There are no words with double U to decode, so no vacuum. You need to handle the 04 case where there could be a Q or a U. 
   - single [[0]][[4]] is a U
   - double [[0]][[4]] is a Q followed by U

testCases.title: The Quick Brown Fox
testCases.testOut:
THE
QUICK
BROWN
FOX
JUMPS
OVER
THE
LAZY
DOGS
BACK

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testOut:
TWO
QUICK
BROWN
FOXES
JUMP
OVER
THE
LAZY
DOGS
BACK

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read LINE:string(100)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of lines to decode.

<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Space sparated integer pairs [[X]][[Y]] for each letter coordinate

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a 5 x 5 grid of letters where top-left is (0, 0), output the decoded lines of text.

  A     B     C     D     E
  J     I     H     G     F
  K     L     M     N     O
  T     S     R     Z     P
 Q/U    V     W     X     Y


Decode example: 13 = (1, 3) = S

There are no words with double U to decode, so no vacuum. You need to handle the 04 case where there could be a Q or a U.
- single 04 is a U
- double 04 is a Q followed by U
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of lines to decode.

Next N lines: Space sparated integer pairs XY for each letter coordinate
Output
N lines of decoded text
Constraints
1≤ N ≤ 10
0 < x,y < 5
Example
Input
1
21 40 12 12 42
Output
HELLO
